title: 750 million genetically engineered mosquitoes approved for release in Florida Keys
description: A plan to release millions of genetically modified mosquitoes in 2021 has won final approval from authorities in the Florida Keys, despite the objection of many local residents and a coalition of environmental advocacy groups.

title: Google Maps has a new, more colorful look
description: Google Maps just unveiled its latest redesign. The new maps are more colorful and show more details so users can better understand what kind of terrain they're looking at.

title: A far-right activist banned from social media just won a Republican nomination
description: If you've paid attention to the rise of the radical right on the internet over the last few years, you know the name Laura Loomer.

title: Series of Berlin highway crashes are 'suspected Islamist act,' say prosecutors
description: Police in Germany have arrested a 30-year-old man whom they say caused a series of motorway incidents in Berlin, in what prosecutors say is a "suspected Islamist act."

title: Some US colleges change plans after infections among students
description: Colleges across the country are quickly learning it may be next to impossible to create a coronavirus-free environment on campus.

title: Flood waters reached the toes of this famous giant Buddha statue for the first time in decades
description: Floods in southern China have caused water from the Yangtze River to reach the toes of a famous gigantic statue of the Buddha -- reportedly for the first time in decades.

title: In 60 seconds, AOC shows she's the future of the Democratic Party
Florida reports more than 4,000 new Covid-19 cases
'Tiger King' zoo closes after feds suspend its license
description: The zoo featured in the "Tiger King" documentary announced late Tuesday it is closed to the public after its federal animal exhibition license was suspended.

title: 10 more eggs harvested from the only two northern white rhinos left in the world
description: Scientists in Kenya found success once again in harvesting eggs from the only two northern white rhinos worldwide, furthering the initiative to save the animal from extinction.

title: Police officer freed by firefighters after getting stuck in his own handcuffs
description: A British police officer needed to be rescued by firefighters after getting his hands stuck in a pair of handcuffs.

title: Trump 'cancels' Goodyear tires as he campaigns against 'cancel culture'
description: President Donald Trump is calling on his followers to not buy Goodyear tires, despite previously railing against "cancel culture," after an employee posted a viral photo of a company policy banning "Make America Great Again" and other political attire in the workplace.

title: Here's what happened when students went to school during the 1918 pandemic
Why the Mali coup could worry Trump and Macron
description: A coup in Mali, West Africa, could have ramifications far beyond its borders, threatening to further destabilize across the region and jeopardizing counter-insurgency efforts led by France and the United States.

title: Apple is now worth $2 trillion
description: Among its many accomplishments  -- the iPhone, the iPad, iTunes, the App store -- Apple can now boast of one more: It is now worth more than $2 trillion, making it the first company in the United States to reach that milestone.

title: Steven Spielberg has written some Black characters into his 'West Side Story' remake
description: Oscar-winning director Steven Spielberg is taking steps to promote more diversity and inclusion in Hollywood by adding multiple Black characters to his remake of the classic musical "West Side Story."

title: In 60 seconds, AOC shows she's the future of the party
description:
• AOC offers short but powerful words at DNC
• Risky roll call turns into moment of unity
• ANALYSIS: Hits and misses from Night Two
• What to watch on third night of the convention

title: Can't figure out what to watch? Netflix is trying out a shuffle button
description: Ever find yourself endlessly scrolling through Netflix trying to find something to watch? You're not alone, and the company may have found a solution.

title: Person with Covid-19 may have exposed others at motorcycle rally
description: A person who spent hours at a bar during the Sturgis motorcycle rally in South Dakota last week has tested positive for Covid-19, state health officials said Tuesday.

title: How Tokyo's massive lost & found works
description: The bad news—you lost your wallet in Tokyo. The good news—chances are good you will get it back, along with all the cash tucked inside. In Japan, residents are diligent about making sure what's lost is found and returned to its rightful owner. This is how the city's stunningly efficient Lost & Found system works.

title: Lavender sales are surging during the coronavirus pandemic
description: Lavender sales are surging as people seek relief from stress and sleep deprivation during the pandemic.

title: The Girl Scouts used to segregate Black and White girls. Now they have their first Black CEO
description: The Girl Scouts of the USA has reached a milestone. After more than a century, and a history which included racially segregated troops in its early years, the organization has appointed its first Black CEO.

title: Senate intelligence report warns of repeat of Russian interference in US election
description: A Senate Intelligence Committee report detailing how Russia's 2016 election interference was encouraged by President Donald Trump and his campaign raises the stakes for the current campaign at a time when Trump is openly amplifying Russian disinformation.

title: Why is the plague still a thing in 2020? And are you at risk of getting it?
description: Plague, one of the deadliest bacterial infections in human history, caused an estimated 50 million deaths in Europe during the Middle Ages when it was known as the Black Death.

title: Why people talk to chatbots in times of trouble
description: During the depths of winter, temperatures in Burlington, Vermont, a state in the US Northeast, can drop far below freezing. Blizzards howl and the snow creeps up to knee level.

title: Duffer brothers talk future of 'Stranger Things'
description: Season 4 of "Stranger Things" won't be the end of the show.

title: Lavender sales are soaring due to Covid-19. Here's why.
description: Lavender has been used for centuries to ward off illness. The coronavirus pandemic has seen a renewed interest in the fragrant crop.

title: CNN Poll: Most Americans embarrassed by US response to coronavirus
description: Nearly 7 in 10 Americans say the US response to the coronavirus outbreak makes them feel embarrassed, according to a new CNN Poll conducted by SSRS, as 62% of the public says President Donald Trump could be doing more to fight the outbreak.

title: Honey may be better at treating coughs and colds than over-the-counter medicines
description: Honey may be a better treatment for coughs and colds than over-the-counter medicines, a new study has found.

title: Australia secures deal for potential Covid-19 vaccine
description:
• First Covid-19 vaccine trial moving at a good clip in US, but officials still 'very concerned'
• Live: Global Covid-19 cases surpass 22M
• News in brief: What you need to know about coronavirus today

title: Taiwan to ban Chinese streaming services
description: Taiwan is preparing to ban iQiyi and Tencent from operating streaming video services on the island, the latest in a series of moves by governments around the world against Chinese tech giants.

title: Late-night have their say on Michelle Obama's DNC speech
description: Late-night hosts lauded Michelle Obama's Democratic National Convention speech as she calls out Donald Trump.

title: During the influenza pandemic that killed an estimated 5 million people worldwide, three schools stayed open
description: • Why is the plague still a thing in 2020? And are you at risk of getting it?

title: Lionel Messi is 'pillar' of new Barca project
description: Amid fevered speculation that Lionel Messi's days at Barcelona are numbered, the club's president has insisted his star playmaker is going nowhere.

title: League of Legends is growing. Traditional sports better watch out
description: With its millions of viewers, lucrative titles and sell-out competitions, it should come as no surprise that the world of esports is beginning to challenge some of Europe's most established sports.

title: 'The nightmare has ended': Victims address the Golden State Killer in court
description: Nearly every victim who took the stand against the Golden State Killer on Tuesday called him a monster -- one they were finally able to face after decades of waiting.

title: Meet the artist who paints with her eyes
description: London-based artist Sarah Ezekiel has won international recognition for her vivid, life-affirming images. But her work is all the more remarkable for the fact that she has a medical condition that has left her unable to move her arms.

title: Blind musician can feel conductor's movements, thanks to high-tech baton
description: When Kyungho Jeon was young, he dreamed of playing in an orchestra, but his teachers feared it would be too difficult -- not because he lacked musical talent, but because he was born blind, and couldn't see a conductor's movements to follow their cues.

title: So you want to quit vaping? Read this to do it for good
description: There is no denying that vaping is popular among teens, with one-third of US high school students reporting they have vaped or used other electronic nicotine products recently, according to a 2019 study.

title: How a village grandmother became a YouTube sensation
description: It has become a common phenomenon in the digital age: undiscovered talent finds fame online. But this tech-centric, rags-to-riches story isn't quite the same, because Gangavva Milkuri is not your typical YouTube star.

title: Lakers wear red MAGA-like hats but the message asks for justice for Breonna Taylor
description: LeBron James and other Los Angeles Lakers sent a message on Tuesday as they arrived at the arena.

title: World Photography Day: 5 of the year's best photo stories
description: With Wednesday marking World Photography Day 2020, CNN Style is looking back at some of the most striking photo series published over the past 12 months.

title: Anderson Cooper clashes with MyPillow creator: How do you sleep at night?
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper grills "MyPillow" creator Mike Lindell regarding his claims that oleandrin is a potential therapeutic for coronavirus.
